newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Netanyahu apologises to Chirac over security flap.
newsitem.headline: Netanyahu apologises to Chirac over security flap.

text.p: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologised on Tuesday to French President Jacques Chirac, who had complained about the tight security Israel imposed during his visit to the Old City of Jerusalem.

"I want first of all to apologise for what happened this morning. President Chirac told me what happened...I am very sorry. We did that for a good cause, to protect a friend," Netanyahu said during a photo opportunity with Chirac.
Chirac made no comment as he sat beside Netanyahu.
Earlier, Chirac's spokeswoman said the French leader would lodge an official protest with Netanyahu over the all-embracing protection for his visit to Moslem and Christian holy sites in Jerusalem.

A red-faced Chirac, teeth clenched and elbows flailing, snapped at Israeli security men to "go away" as he got his first taste of the type of protection that has been in force in Israel for local and visiting leaders since Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin was assassinated a year ago.
Security men wrestled journalists away from his party and armed border guards stood poised outside each Palestinian shop on the walking tour of the walled Old City.
